overview_of_class: This course will provide an brief overview of programming methodology and introduction to the Matlab package. The majority of the course will consist of hands-on exercises in programming and data analysis, with topics tailored to the interested of the enrolled students. Programming experience is encouraged but not required. You will need to bring a laptop with Matlab and Psychtoolbox installed from the second class onward. Depending on previous experience, expect between 1-5 hours of homework and practice outside of class per week.
name: Special Topics in Cognition
title: WCAS PSYCH 460-0-20 Special Topics in Cognition

descriptions.value: This course will provide an brief overview of programming methodology and introduction to the Matlab package. The majority of the course will consist of hands-on exercises in programming and data analysis, with topics tailored to the interested of the enrolled students. Programming experience is encouraged but not required. You will need to bring a laptop with Matlab and Psychtoolbox installed from the second class onward. Depending on previous experience, expect between 1-5 hours of homework and practice outside of class per week.

subject: PSYCH

overview_of_class: This graduate seminar will explore how the human visual system extracts, abstracts, and manipulates information not from the natural world around us, but from artificial worlds on screens and paper - diagrams, maps, and data visualizations - that are critical to science and education. What mechanisms allow people to understand visually encoded patterns in data displays? What are the capacity limits of visual understanding, and how do visualizations take advantage of high-capacity processing while skirting low-capacity? What aesthetic and design principles make a visualization understandable and engaging, and why do these principles work? Students will present sets of papers, engage in discussion, and write short final paper summarizing a literature of interest.
name: Special Topics in Cognition
title: WCAS PSYCH 460-0-21 Special Topics in Cognition
